Wisdom: الْمُتَّقِي مَنِ اتَّقَى الذُّنُوبَ وَالْمُتَنَزِّهُ مَنْ تَنَزَّهَ عَنِ الْعُيُوبِ
enWisdom: The God-wary is one who guards against sins, and the purified is one who purifies himself of faults

Wisdom: التَّقْوَى أَنْ يَتَّقِيَ الْمَرْءُ كُلَّ مَا يُؤْثِمُهُ
enWisdom: God-wariness is for a person to be cautious of all [the things] that could lead him towards sin
The best [form of] piety is keeping away from lustful desires
Piety is nothing but the purification of oneself from sins

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا الْوَرَعُ التَّحَرِّي فِي الْمَكَاسِبِ وَالْكَفُّ عَنِ الْمَطَالِبِ
enWisdom: Piety is nothing but scrutinizing one’s earnings [to ensure lawfulness] and abstaining from worldly pursuits
Piety is stopping when faced with doubt
The probity of God-wariness is [in] eschewing doubt
There is no piety like self-restraint
